unnormalised: The annual "Mango Mania" festival in Ratnagiri is reportedly preponed due to an unforeseen… well, mango-related emergency. Organisers initially scheduled the event for 10/05/2024, but citing an "unprecedented early ripening phenomenon," they’ve now decided to kick things off on 25/04/2024, a whole fortnight earlier! One can only assume it involves a mountain of mangoes threatening to spontaneously combust from sheer deliciousness.
normalised: The annual "Mango Mania" festival in Ratnagiri is reportedly preponed due to an unforeseen… well, mango-related emergency. Organizers initially scheduled the event for tenth May two thousand and twenty four, but citing an "unprecedented early ripening phenomenon," they’ve now decided to kick things off on twenty fifth April two thousand and twenty four, a whole fortnight earlier! One can only assume it involves a mountain of mangoes threatening to spontaneously combust from sheer deliciousness.

unnormalised: "We simply couldn’t wait," chuckled Mr. Desai, the festival chairman, in a press release issued at exactly 4:20 PM yesterday (no, really). "The Alphonso gods have blessed us with an exceptionally bountiful harvest, and delaying the festival would be a crime against flavour." He then added, "Plus, my wife threatened to leave if I made her wait any longer for her yearly supply."
normalised: "We simply couldn’t wait," chuckled Mister Desai, the festival chairman, in a press release issued at exactly four twenty P-M yesterday (no, really). "The Alphonso gods have blessed us with an exceptionally bountiful harvest, and delaying the festival would be a crime against flavor." He then added, "Plus, my wife threatened to leave if I made her wait any longer for her yearly supply."

unnormalised: The event will feature mango-eating contests (obviously), cooking demos, and a slightly terrifying "Mango Art" exhibition, starting sharp at 10:00 AM. Visitors are advised to wear stretchy pants and prepare for a sugar rush that lasts approximately 72 hrs.
normalised: The event will feature mango-eating contests (obviously), cooking demos, and a slightly terrifying "Mango Art" exhibition, starting sharp at ten zero zero A-M. Visitors are advised to wear stretchy pants and prepare for a sugar rush that lasts approximately seventy two hours.

unnormalised: Tickets are selling faster than hot jalebis, so book yours before they’re all gone! Don't miss the chance to witness history (and possibly develop Type 2 diabetes). The festival will conclude tentatively around 6:00 PM on 27/04/2024, unless, of course, the mangoes decide to throw another curveball.
normalised: Tickets are selling faster than hot jalebis, so book yours before they’re all gone! Don't miss the chance to witness history (and possibly develop Type two diabetes). The festival will conclude tentatively around six zero zero P-M on twenty seventh April two thousand and twenty four, unless, of course, the mangoes decide to throw another curveball.
